page.title: 08Village customs
page.content: Every year in November the traditional Hunt Week takes place. The Coniston foxhounds are temporarily kenneled at one of the local farms and two or three hunts are held during the week. A hunt 'ball' with supper is held at the Institute and up to 100 people may come. It is a major social event for the community. Shepherd's Meet takes place on one of the days. Its origins stretch back many years to the days when it was the time for collecting and distributing sheep which had strayed in earlier months. Today it is dealt with by Land Rover and trailer as it happens, but the tradition is kept alive by making a pen at the Queen's Head for stray sheep brought in for sorting. Hounds and harriers meet, hot pot is served all day and there is a sing-song after the hunt.
